p:
The study was undertaken within Kilifi County in Coastal Kenya, at nine health facilities namely: Matsangoni, Ngerenya, Mtondia, Sokoke, Mavueni, Jaribuni, Chasimba, Pingilikani and Junju, all located within the KHDSS as previously described
30 . The county has a population of about 1,109,735 and is predominantly rural; the main economic activities include fishing, tourism and subsistence farming. The area has a tropical climate with two rainy seasons (long rains in April to July and short rains in October to December). The KHDSS area in which the study was restricted covers 891km 2 and has a population of 287,014 (mid-point 2016) which is heterogeneously distributed with the highest density in Kilifi township
30 .
